# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)  # Output will be something like:
                       # This is a very
                       # long string that
                       # should be wrapped
                       # at 10 characters
                       # per line.
